definitions.definition: An ongoing relationship between (usually two) rivals who compete for superiority .
examples: The Boston Bruins have a longstanding rivalry with the Montreal Canadiens.
James and Polly have a bitter rivalry due to the latter's inclusion in the Tea Time Teaser.

definitions.definition: The characteristic of being a rivalrous good, such that it can be consumed or used by only one person at a time.
examples: Common goods are those which are rivalrous in consumption but non-excludable

definitions.definition: Any competition between two or more things or factors.
examples: Binocular rivalry is a visual phenomenon in which perception alternates between different images presented to each eye.

main_definition: An ongoing relationship between (usually two) rivals who compete for superiority .
secondary_definitions: ( economics ) The characteristic of being a rivalrous good, such that it can be consumed or used by only one person at a time.
Any competition between two or more things or factors.
